hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Before Liquidity Expansion
hypothesis_content.statement: When 4-hour realized volatility drops below 20% annualized while cumulative order flow turns positive, a liquidity expansion event occurs within 3 candles with 75% probability, creating breakout opportunities.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility with accumulating bid pressure indicates accumulation phase. Market makers widen spreads in anticipation of large orders. When liquidity finally enters, it creates asymmetric moves as resting orders get filled.
entry_conditions: Cumulative order flow (bid volume - ask volume) > 0 for 3 consecutive hours
Total bid depth increasing while ask depth decreasing

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price breaks 4-hour ATR(14) * 1.5 in direction of order flow
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility expands in opposite direction of order flow

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction is random (<55% accuracy) or occurs beyond 12-hour window consistently
